meanings.definition: Versals (noun): a typeface characterized by straight lines and angular shapes
meanings.sent1: The book cover had elegant versals at the beginning of each chapter.
meanings.sent2: The calligraphy artist used intricate versals to decorate the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The graphic designer playfully incorporated colorful versals into the logo design.
meanings.sent4: The ancient manuscript featured ornate versals that seemed to dance on the page.
meanings.sent5: The versals in the typography workshop were so captivating that everyone wanted to learn more.

meanings.definition: Versals (adjective): relating to or characteristic of a typeface with straight lines and angular shapes
meanings.sent1: The poster had a bold and modern look with its versals font.
meanings.sent2: Her notebook was filled with sketches of versals letters she wanted to use in her project.
meanings.sent3: The website redesign included a sleek and stylish use of versals throughout.
meanings.sent4: The street artist's mural featured vibrant colors and versals that popped against the wall.
meanings.sent5: The invitation had an elegant touch with the use of gold foiled versals on the front.

meanings.definition: Versals (verb): to set or print in a typeface with straight lines and angular shapes
meanings.sent1: The printer carefully versaled the title on the cover of the book.
meanings.sent2: She versals each heading in the report to make them stand out.
meanings.sent3: The typographer versals the text to give it a classic and timeless look.
meanings.sent4: He versals the logo on the packaging to make it more visually appealing.
meanings.sent5: The artist versals the quote on the canvas to create a striking visual impact.
